title: Format of the geometrical surface description.

___Meshes.description: Surfaces which are composed of (a) collection(s) of polygonal meshes.

___Nodes.description: The coordinates in space where the vertices/nodes of the mesh are located.

___Elements.description: The three node indices which together make up a triangle of a mesh of a material.

$eref.description: Whether the volume the surface describe reaches into infinity.

___Neighbors.description: Array of the ids of the neighboring meshes.

___ElementIndices.description: Array of the id of the element.

The unique name of the medium.

___Singulars.description: Surfaces which are composed of (a) collection(s) of singular shapes.

___Collections.description: Each collection should form a 2-D manifold.

___ShapeIndices.description:
The shapes that form the inner or outer shell of the volume.
A minus sign indicates that the outward pointing normal vectors of the shape should be inverted to point outward of the manifold.

anyOf.description: Infinite planar surface (IPS) that is required to be parallel to other IPS objects, i.e. if all IPS objects have the same normal vector, they will intersect yielding an incorrect topology.

___Normal.description: Direction of the normal vector to the plane.

___Center.description: Location of the center of the plane
